quote.msg: U can’t drive in Au without international driver license plus p license cannot transfer to international license dumb as fk

replies.msg:
P牌而持Temporary Visa都可以唔需要International License直接喺澳洲合法揸車，啫係話旅行係可以用香港P牌自駕遊同租車，但係可能貴啲

而如果想用香港牌轉澳洲牌係可以但需要證明駕駛經驗，要向運輸署申駕駛執照細節證明書，但駕駛經驗必須超過一年 = 甩咗P先得；而且廿五歲以下通常需要補考Knowledge Test and Driving Test，廿五歲或以上可以免試直接換 (每個state可能會有少少唔同)

replies.msg:
If you hold a temporary visa:

you are not required to get a Victorian driver licence and/or learner permit
you can drive using your current overseas driver licence for the length of your stay
your driver licence must be written in English or accompanied by an English translation or international driving permit.

Source: https://www.vicroads.vic.gov.au/licences/renew-replace-or-update/new-to-victoria/overseas-drivers

replies.msg:
It depends on different States in Australia,

Take Victoria State as example:

https://www.vicroads.vic.gov.au/licences/renew-replace-or-update/new-to-victoria/overseas-drivers

When using your overseas licence to drive in Victoria, all the road rules and laws apply to you. It’s also important to keep in mind that:

1. Your overseas licence needs to be current and valid
2. If your overseas licence is in a language other than English, you also need to carry an English translation or international driving permit whenever you drive.
But ‘P’ plates need to be displayed


Furthermore, you can use your Hong Kong Learner License to drive in Victoria State under supervision of experienced drivers

Can I use my overseas learner permit?
Yes, if you are supervised by a full driver licence holder who is authorised to drive the category of that vehicle in Victoria and who is also sitting beside you. Go to How to get your Ls for more information about getting your Victorian learner permit. But ‘L’ plates need to be displayed.
